subject: Request for Database Applications Tested with JUnit and DBUnit
msgSnippet: Hello, I am involved with a research project that is focusing on the testing and analysis of database applications.  Our research addresses test adequacy, test
messageBody:
Hello,

I am involved with a research project that is focusing on the testing
and analysis of database applications. Our research addresses test
adequacy, test suite execution, test coverage monitoring, regression
test selection and prioritization, and test data generation.
Currently, we have a number of case study applications that we use
during the experimental evaluation of the efficiency and effectiveness
of our algorithms.

However, we are interested in applying our techniques to new
applications written by additional software developers. In
particular, we are currently interested in testing applications that
(i) interact with relational databases through SQL Strings and JDBC
drivers, (ii) use an RDBMS such as HSQLDB, MySQL, or PostreSQL (with a
preference to programs that use HSLQDB), (iii) use the DBUnit and
JUnit testing frameworks, and (iv) includes the tracking of defects
and version information.

If you are developing a program that fits (or nearly fits)
requirements (i) - (iv), could you contact me on or off list with
information about your project? If your application does not have all
of the above characteristics (e.g., no defect tracking or the use of a
different RDBMS) I would still be interested in learning more about
your project. Also, I would be excited to learn more about your
testing approach beyond those discussions that have already taken
place on this list.

Kind Regards,

greg

--
Gregory M. Kapfhammer
Instructor, Computer Science Department
Allegheny College
Office: 814-332-2880
gkapfham(at)allegheny(dot)edu
http://cs.allegheny.edu/~gkapfham/
